meanings.definition: Someone or something that hastens or speeds up a process.
meanings.sent1: The little bird, a hastener of dawn, chirped loudly to wake everyone up.
meanings.sent2: The delivery truck, a reliable hastener, always arrived on time.
meanings.sent3: The energetic squirrel, a hastener of nut gathering, never took a break.
meanings.sent4: The wind, a natural hastener of drying clothes, billowed through the backyard.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock, a persistent hastener, beeped until I woke up.

meanings.definition: To cause something to happen sooner or more quickly.
meanings.sent1: She tried to hasten the cooking process by turning up the heat.
meanings.sent2: The teacher hastened the students to finish their assignments before the bell rang.
meanings.sent3: The cat hastened its pace when it heard the sound of a can opening.
meanings.sent4: The rain hastened the wilting of the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The urgent phone call hastened his decision to leave work early.
